intro: Leleba prava, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its velvety, heart-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial herb, often reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light for optimal growth. Leleba prava is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
